intro: Oxydectes turrialva, commonly known as the Turrialva oxydectes, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
